definitions: Any of a number of creeping or burrowing invertebrate animals with long, slender soft bodies and no limbs.
Used in names of long slender insect larvae, especially those in fruit or wood, e.g. army worm, woodworm.
Used in names of other animals that resemble worms in some way, e.g. slow-worm, shipworm.
A maggot regarded as eating corpses buried in the ground.
A weak or despicable person (often used as a general term of abuse)
The threaded cylinder in a worm gear.
The coiled pipe of a still in which the vapour is cooled and condensed.
A self-replicating program able to propagate itself across a network, typically having a detrimental effect.
